docs.snippet: Wall Street stock index futures were little changed throughout Sunday's highly contentious presidential debate, indicating that markets continue to view that Democrat Hillary Clinton holds an edge in the Nov. 8 election against her Republican riva...
docs.lead_paragraph: Wall Street stock index futures were little changed throughout Sunday's highly contentious presidential debate, indicating that markets continue to view that Democrat Hillary Clinton holds an edge in the Nov. 8 election against her Republican rival, Donald Trump.

headline.main: Financial Markets Continue to Price in Clinton Win After Debate
headline.print_headline: Financial Markets Continue to Price in Clinton Win After Debate

docs.snippet: House Speaker Paul Ryan, the nation's top elected Republican, effectively abandoned Donald Trump Monday, telling anxious fellow lawmakers he will not campaign for or defend the floundering businessman in the election's closing weeks. Pro-Trump mem...
docs.lead_paragraph: House Speaker Paul Ryan, the nation's top elected Republican, effectively abandoned Donald Trump Monday, telling anxious fellow lawmakers he will not campaign for or defend the floundering businessman in the election's closing weeks. Pro-Trump members rebelled in anger, accusing Ryan of conceding the election to Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Giving Up on Trump? Ryan Focusing on Saving GOP Majority
headline.print_headline: Giving Up on Trump? Ryan Focusing on Saving GOP Majority

docs.snippet: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell refused to acknowledge Donald Trump on Monday, telling a group of business leaders in his home state of Kentucky that if they expected to hear him discuss the presidential race they "might as well go ahe...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell refused to acknowledge Donald Trump on Monday, telling a group of business leaders in his home state of Kentucky that if they expected to hear him discuss the presidential race they "might as well go ahead and leave."

headline.main: As Some in GOP Sever Ties With Trump, McConnell Ignores Him
headline.print_headline: As Some in GOP Sever Ties With Trump, McConnell Ignores Him
